question.body: Which of the following of the five major peritoneal folds is not properly matched with its description?

multiple_choice.choice: Greater omentum -- attaches the liver to the anterior abdominal wall
Lesser omentum -- suspends the stomach and duodenum from the liver
Mesentery -- attaches the jejunum and ileum of the small intestine to the posterior abdominal wall
Mesocolon- attaches the transverse colon and sigmoid colon to the posterior abdominal wall

response.feedback: Correct. The greater omentum drapes over the transverse colon and small intestine. The falciform ligament attaches the liver to the anterior abdominal wall.
Incorrect. This is the proper description of the lesser omentum
Incorrect. This is the proper description of the mesentery.
Incorrect. This is the proper description of the mesocolon.
